column4: hi guys - i'm trying to install amarok 1.4.5, but following the instructions on the kubuntu site doesn't work, it doesn't want to update
anyone know what the problem is? ;/
Is there a particular reason you can't use the version in the repos?
not really - i just want the newest version, is that a problem? :p
No problem at all; I was just curious.  No sense in overcomplicating things if you don't need to.
In general, I try to wait for the repos to handle things if possible, because manually installing an app tends to mean that aptitude no longer automatically updates it.
but the kubuntu guide tells me to add a repo that has it in, then it should just upgrade :/
Oh, I see - you're not *manually* installing it, you're just trying to GET the version in the repos.
yea
Okay, so, amaroK is already installed, right?  Which version do you have right now?
According to my repository cache, 1.4.3 is the latest version available in the repositories.
It happens often that the repositories won't have the latest version actually available - lots of work has to be done to make sure that installing the new version won't break anyone's system.
http://kubuntu.org/announcements/amarok-1.4.5.php
I assume you've added that repository?  Have you run "sudo apt-get update" since adding that repo to your /etc/apt/sources.list?
yes
Hmm... try doing "sudo aptitude install amarok=1.4.5"
Unable to find a version "1.4.5" for the package "amarok"
Humm... what about amarok=2:1.4.5-0ubuntu10
same :(
Lame.  I'm afraid I have no answer for you, my friend.
Have you asked in #kubuntu?
well, i thought since i was on ubuntu, i'd ask here first :/
